actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 101-223, by Mr. Frost.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 1594 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Any time after the adoption of this resolution the Speaker may declare the House resolved into the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union to consider the bill and specified amendments thereto. Measure will be read by title. Specified amendments are in order. No amendment to the bill shall be in order except amendments recommended by the Committee on Ways and Means, which shall not be subject to amendment.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 49.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 173 (Roll no. 223).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1594) to extend nondiscriminatory treatment to the products of the People's Republic of Hungary for 5 years.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 1594 (Hungary most-favored-nation treatment).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 1594) to extend nondiscriminatory treatment to the products of the People's Republic of Hungary for 5 years.
